DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Arm First Randomization Assignment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The assignment to a specific treatment regimen or arm at first randomization when more than one protocol treatment is described.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Arm First Randomization Assignment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment._An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Technically the part of the superior limb between the shoulder and the elbow but commonly used to refer to the whole superior limb.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:Assignment; an undertaking that you have been assigned to do.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.
An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
